question: [File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_proof_with_ledger_info()] [More Flag] Line 615 gets epoch ending ledger infos with a 'more' flag - if more is true, does the proof become invalid? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_proof()] [Latest Ledger Info Race] Can get_latest_ledger_info() return a ledger info that becomes stale by the time get_state_proof_with_ledger_info processes it? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_value_by_version()] [State KV Pruning] Does error_if_state_kv_pruned at line 637 check all relevant pruning windows, or can some pruned state values still be accessed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_value_by_version()] [Key Hash Collision] Can state_store_key hash collisions cause this function to return wrong state values for keys with different hashes but same lookup? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_value_by_version()] [None vs Deleted] When returning None, can callers distinguish between 'key never existed' vs 'key was deleted' vs 'key is pruned'? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_value_with_version_by_version()] [Version Mismatch] Can the returned version in the tuple be different from the requested version parameter, and if so, does this cause security issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_value_with_version_by_version()] [Stale Version Return] If a key is updated after 'version' but before this call executes, can the version in the returned tuple reflect the newer update incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_proof_by_version_ext()] [Root Depth Manipulation] Can an attacker provide arbitrary root_depth values to generate invalid or incomplete Merkle proofs that appear valid? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_proof_by_version_ext()] [Key Hash Validation] Is key_hash validated to be a valid hash of an existing key, or can arbitrary hash values be used to probe the Merkle tree structure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_proof_by_version_ext()] [Merkle Pruning] Does error_if_state_merkle_pruned at line 665 properly prevent access to pruned Merkle tree nodes needed for proof generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_value_with_proof_by_version_ext()] [Value-Proof Consistency] Can the returned StateValue and SparseMerkleProofExt become inconsistent if state changes occur between retrieving the value and generating the proof? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_value_with_proof_by_version_ext()] [Proof Depth Attack] Can providing root_depth=0 or very large values cause proof generation to fail or generate proofs that don't verify correctly? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_latest_epoch_state()] [Epoch State Source] At lines 689-695, there are two sources for epoch state (next_epoch_state or current epoch) - can this create inconsistencies if called during epoch transitions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_latest_epoch_state()] [Clone Safety] Line 690 clones the epoch_state - can the original be modified after cloning, creating stale validator sets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_latest_epoch_state()] [Fallback Logic] When next_epoch_state is None (lines 691-694), fallback to get_epoch_state - can this return an epoch state from a different epoch than intended? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_pre_committed_ledger_summary()] [State Lock Duration] Does current_state_locked() at lines 701-704 hold locks too long, creating DoS opportunities when called repeatedly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_pre_committed_ledger_summary()] [Frozen Subtrees Race] Between getting num_txns at line 705 and calling get_frozen_subtree_hashes at lines 707-710, can new transactions be committed, making the accumulator inconsistent? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_pre_committed_ledger_summary()] [Accumulator Construction] Line 712 constructs InMemoryAccumulator from frozen_subtrees - can malformed or inconsistent frozen_subtrees cause this to panic or create invalid accumulators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_pre_committed_ledger_summary()] [State Summary Consistency] Are state, state_summary, and transaction_accumulator guaranteed to be from the same version, or can they drift apart? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_block_timestamp()] [Block Info Retrieval] Does get_raw_block_info_by_version validate that the version is actually a block start, or can it return timestamps for mid-block versions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_block_timestamp()] [Timestamp Manipulation] Can timestamp_usecs() return manipulated timestamps if the NewBlockEvent was crafted by a malicious proposer? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_latest_block_events()] [Descending Order Attack] At lines 736-742, when !skip_index_and_usage, events are fetched in descending order - can this ordering be exploited to skip certain blocks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_latest_block_events()] [Iterator Reverse] Lines 745-763 use rev_iter() and seek_to_last() - can this iteration be inconsistent with the forward iteration path? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_latest_block_events()] [Version Comparison] Line 753 checks 'first_version <= *v' - can this comparison be wrong at version 0 or near u64::MAX? (Low)
